    • distanceOfInheritance

      public static int distanceOfInheritance(Class<?> child, Class<?> parent)

      Returns the number of inheritance hops between two classes.

      Parameters:
      child - the child class, may be null
      parent - the parent class, may be null
      Returns:
      the number of generations between the child and parent; 0 if the same class; -1 if the classes are not related as child and parent (includes where either class is null)

    • forClass

      public static <T> Class<T> forClass(String clsName) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the Class object associated with the class or interface with the given string name. This method supports primitive types: boolean, char, byte, short, int, long, float, double. And array type with format java.lang.String[]
      Type Parameters:
      T -
      Parameters:
      clsName -
      Returns:
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if class not found.

    • formalizePropName

      public static String formalizePropName(String propName)
      Formalizes the given property name by converting it to camel case and replacing any reserved keywords with their mapped values. It's designed for field/method/class/column/table names. and source and target Strings will be cached.
      Parameters:
      propName - the property name to be formalized
      Returns:
      the formalized property name

    • formatParameterizedTypeName

      public static String formatParameterizedTypeName(String parameterizedTypeName)
      Formats the parameterized type name by removing unnecessary prefixes and suffixes. This method handles array types and removes "class" and "interface" prefixes.
      Parameters:
      parameterizedTypeName - the parameterized type name to format
      Returns:
      the formatted parameterized type name

      public static String getCanonicalClassName(Class<?> cls)
      Retrieves the canonical name of the specified class. If the canonical name is not available, it returns the class name.
      Parameters:
      cls - the class whose canonical name is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the canonical name of the class, or the class name if the canonical name is not available

    • getClassesByPackage

      public static List<Class<?>> getClassesByPackage(String pkgName, boolean isRecursive, boolean skipClassLoaddingException) throws UncheckedIOException
      Retrieves a list of classes in the specified package.
      Parameters:
      pkgName - the name of the package to search for classes
      isRecursive - if true, searches recursively in sub-packages
      skipClassLoaddingException - if true, skips classes that cannot be loaded
      Returns:
      a list of classes in the specified package
      Throws:
      UncheckedIOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • getClassesByPackage

      public static List<Class<?>> getClassesByPackage(String pkgName, boolean isRecursive, boolean skipClassLoaddingException, Predicate<? super Class<?>> predicate) throws UncheckedIOException
      Retrieves a list of classes in the specified package.
      Parameters:
      pkgName - the name of the package to search for classes
      isRecursive - if true, searches recursively in sub-packages
      skipClassLoaddingException - if true, skips classes that cannot be loaded
      predicate - a predicate to filter the classes
      Returns:
      a list of classes in the specified package
      Throws:
      UncheckedIOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • getAllInterfaces

      public static Set<Class<?>> getAllInterfaces(Class<?> cls)
      Copied from Apache Commons Lang under Apache License v2.

      Gets a List of all interfaces implemented by the given class and its super classes.

      The order is determined by looking through each interface in turn as declared in the source file and following its hierarchy up. Then each superclass is considered in the same way. Later duplicates are ignored, so the order is maintained.

      Parameters:
      cls - the class to look up.
      Returns:

      Parameters:
      cls - the class to look up.
      Returns:

      Parameters:

      propNameValueFilter - the bi-predicate to filter property names and values, where the first parameter is the property name and the second parameter is the property value

    • getPropGetMethod

      public static Method getPropGetMethod(Class<?> cls, String propName)
      Returns the property get method declared in the specified cls with the specified property name propName. null is returned if no method is found. Call registerXMLBindingClassForPropGetSetMethod first to retrieve the property getter/setter method for the class/bean generated/wrote by JAXB specification
      Parameters:
      cls - the class from which the property get method is to be retrieved
      propName - the name of the property whose get method is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the property get method declared in the specified class, or null if no method is found

      Parameters:
      cls - the class from which the property get methods are to be retrieved
      Returns:
      an immutable map of property get methods for the specified class

    • getPropValue

      public static <T> T getPropValue(Object bean, String propName, boolean ignoreUnmatchedProperty)
      Returns the value of the specified property by invoking the getter method associated with the given property name on the provided bean. If the property cannot be found and ignoreUnmatchedProperty is true, it returns null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the property value
      Parameters:
      bean - the object from which the property value is to be retrieved
      propName - the name of the property whose value is to be retrieved
      ignoreUnmatchedProperty - if true, ignores unmatched properties and returns null
      Returns:
      the value of the specified property, or null if the property is not found and ignoreUnmatchedProperty is true
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified property cannot be retrieved and ignoreUnmatchedProperty is false

    • setPropValue

      public static Object setPropValue(Object bean, Method propSetMethod, Object propValue)
      Sets the specified property value on the given bean by invoking the provided setter method. If the property value is null, it sets the default value of the parameter type. If the initial attempt to set the property value fails, it tries to convert the property value to the appropriate type and set it again.
      Parameters:
      bean - the object on which the property value is to be set
      propSetMethod - the method to be invoked to set the property value
      propValue - the value to be set to the property
      Returns:
      the final value that was set to the property
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the underlying method is inaccessible or the method is invoked with incorrect arguments or the underlying method throws an exception

    • setPropValue

      @Deprecated public static void setPropValue(Object bean, String propName, Object propValue)
      Deprecated.
      replaced by ParserUtil.BeanInfo.setPropValue(Object, String, Object)
      Sets the specified property value on the given bean by invoking the setter method associated with the given property name. If the property value is null, it sets the default value of the parameter type. If the initial attempt to set the property value fails, it tries to convert the property value to the appropriate type and set it again.
      Parameters:
      bean - the object on which the property value is to be set
      propName - the name of the property whose value is to be set
      propValue - the value to be set to the property
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified property cannot be set

    • setPropValue

      @Deprecated public static boolean setPropValue(Object bean, String propName, Object propValue, boolean ignoreUnmatchedProperty)
      Deprecated.
      replaced by ParserUtil.BeanInfo.setPropValue(Object, String, Object, boolean)
      Sets the specified property value on the given bean by invoking the setter method associated with the given property name. If the property value is null, it sets the default value of the parameter type. If the initial attempt to set the property value fails, it tries to convert the property value to the appropriate type and set it again.
      Parameters:
      bean - the object on which the property value is to be set
      propName - the name of the property whose value is to be set
      propValue - the value to be set to the property
      ignoreUnmatchedProperty - if true, ignores unmatched properties and returns false
      Returns:
      true if the property value has been set, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified property cannot be set and ignoreUnmatchedProperty is false

    • setPropValueByGet

      public static void setPropValueByGet(Object bean, Method propGetMethod, Object propValue)
      Sets the property value by invoking the getter method on the provided bean. The returned type of the get method should be Collection or Map. And the specified property value and the returned value must be same type.
      Parameters:
      bean - the object on which the property value is to be set
      propGetMethod - the method to be invoked to get the property value
      propValue - the value to be set to the property

    • getBuilderInfo

      public static Tuple.Tuple3<Class<?>,Supplier<Object>,Function<Object,Object>> getBuilderInfo(Class<?> cls) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Retrieves the builder information for the specified class. The builder information includes the class type, a supplier for creating Builder instances, and a function to build the target object from the Builder.
      Parameters:
      cls - the class for which the builder information is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      a tuple containing the class type, a supplier for creating Builder instances, and a function to build the target object from the Builder.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified class is null or the builder information cannot be retrieved

    • invokeConstructor

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T invokeConstructor(Constructor<T> constructor, Object... args)
      Invokes the specified constructor with the given arguments.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to be created
      Parameters:
      constructor - the constructor to be invoked
      args - the arguments to be passed to the constructor
      Returns:
      the newly created object
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the class that declares the underlying constructor represents an abstract class or the underlying constructor is inaccessible or the underlying constructor throws an exception.

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T invokeMethod(Method method, Object... args)
      Invokes the specified method with the given arguments.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to be returned
      Parameters:
      method - the method to be invoked
      args - the arguments to be passed to the method
      Returns:

    • invokeMethod

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T invokeMethod(Object instance, Method method, Object... args)
      Invokes the specified method on the given instance with the provided arguments.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to be returned
      Parameters:
      instance - the object on which the method is to be invoked, or null for static methods
      method - the method to be invoked
      args - the arguments to be passed to the method
      Returns:
      the result of invoking the method
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the underlying method is inaccessible, the method is invoked with incorrect arguments, or the underlying method throws an exception

    • wrap

      public static Class<?> wrap(Class<?> cls) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the corresponding wrapper type of cls if it is a primitive type; otherwise returns cls itself. 
           wrap(int.class) == Integer.class
     wrap(Integer.class) == Integer.class
     wrap(String.class) == String.class
      Parameters:
      cls - the class to be wrapped
      Returns:
      the corresponding wrapper type if cls is a primitive type, otherwise cls itself
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if cls is null

    • unwrap

      public static Class<?> unwrap(Class<?> cls) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the corresponding primitive type of cls if it is a wrapper type; otherwise returns cls itself. 
           unwrap(Integer.class) == int.class
     unwrap(int.class) == int.class
     unwrap(String.class) == String.class
      Parameters:
      cls - the class to be unwrapped
      Returns:
      the corresponding primitive type if cls is a wrapper type, otherwise cls itself
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if cls is null

      public static Object createNullMask()
      Creates and returns a new instance of the None class, which serves as a null mask.
      Returns:
      a new instance of the None class
